`r descr_models("ordinal_reg", "ordinalNet")`

## Tuning Parameters

```{r ordinalNet-param-info, echo=FALSE}
defaults <- 
  tibble::tibble(parsnip = c("penalty", "mixture"),
                 default = c("see below", "1.0"))

param <-
  ordinal_reg() |>
  set_engine("ordinalNet") |>
  set_mode("classification") |>
  make_parameter_list(defaults)
```

This model has `r nrow(param)` tuning parameters:

```{r, ordinalNet-param-list, echo=FALSE, results='asis'}
param$item
```

## Translation from parsnip to the original package

`r uses_extension("ordinal_reg", "ordinalNet", "classification")`

```{r ordinalNet-oreg}
library(ordered)

ordinal_reg() %>% 
  set_engine("ordinalNet") %>% 
  set_mode("classification") %>% 
  translate()
```

## References

- Wurm MJ, Rathouz PJ, Hanlon BM. Regularized Ordinal Regression and the ordinalNet R Package. _Journal of Statistical Software_ 99(6):1-42. \doi{10.18637/jss.v099.i06}.
